alert.note: Alert for Central La Paz; Kofa; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 15 at 8:28PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern La Paz, northeastern Yuma and Maricopa Counties through 915 PM MST... At 828 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Painted Rock Dam to 6 miles southwest of Palo Verde Nuclear Generation Station to 13 miles southwest of Tonopah. Movement was northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Buckeye, Tonopah, Painted Rock Dam, Palo Verde Nuclear Generation Station, Wintersburg, Hassayampa and Arlington. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 66 and 106. AZ Route 85 near mile marker 140. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central La Paz; Kofa; Tonopah Desert
